org.kkevin.xmlmanipulator
Class XMLManipulator

java.lang.Object
  org.kkevin.xmlmanipulator.XMLManipulator

public class XMLManipulator
extends java.lang.Object

This class simply manipulates an XML-Document

Constructor Summary
XMLManipulator(java.lang.String xmlContent)
          Constructor loads a xml formated String as Document
 
Method Summary
 void addXPathNode(java.lang.String xpath, java.lang.String value)
          This function adds a new Node to an valid xpath, to keep the well-form of a document, this function works this way:
- Begin with the first node defined in the XPath
- if it just an attribute add a new node named "node" containing this attribute with an empty value if "value" is empty
to the document root node
- if the document has none this node becomes the root node
- if it is an node check if any node in this document matches this node with all his attributes (first appearence only)
- Matches if a node has all the same attributes and values
- if there is one append the rest of the nodes described by the xpath expression (this will add the attributes contained in predicates too)
- if there is no matching node append the path to the document root node
- if it's an empty document, create this root node using the first node discribed by the xpath

addXPathNode

public void addXPathNode(java.lang.String xpath,
                         java.lang.String value)
                  throws org.jdom.JDOMException,
                         java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
This function adds a new Node to an valid xpath, to keep the well-form of a document, this function works this way:
- Begin with the first node defined in the XPath
- if it just an attribute add a new node named "node" containing this attribute with an empty value if "value" is empty
to the document root node
- if the document has none this node becomes the root node
- if it is an node check if any node in this document matches this node with all his attributes (first appearence only)
- Matches if a node has all the same attributes and values
- if there is one append the rest of the nodes described by the xpath expression (this will add the attributes contained in predicates too)
- if there is no matching node append the path to the document root node
- if it's an empty document, create this root node using the first node discribed by the xpath

Parameters:
xpath - xpath string to traverse
value - value to set into the xpath described node position of the document tree
Throws:
org.jdom.JDOMException
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

removeXPathNode

public void removeXPathNode(java.lang.String xpath,
                            java.lang.String value)
Supposed to remove a node and or just its value if it does no value is defined, not implemented yet

nodeExists

public boolean nodeExists(java.lang.String xpath)
                   throws org.jdom.JDOMException
Returns true if a node to the assigned "xpath" exists, false otherwise.

Parameters:
xpath - to check
Returns:
result of XPath query.
Throws:
org.jdom.JDOMException
